content: A `Popover` is a non-modal dialog that floats around a trigger. It is composed of `Popover`, `PopoverTrigger`, and `PopoverContent`.
Popovers close on outside interaction or the `Esc` key. They trap focus inside them. The `placement` and `offset` props control positioning. The `backdrop` can be `transparent`, `opaque`, or `blur`.
Popovers are suitable for containing forms, as they correctly manage focus. Focus is moved into the popover when it opens and restored to the trigger when it closes.
The popover can have an arrow (`showArrow`), and its enter/exit animations can be customized with `motionProps`. The main stylable slots are `base`, `trigger`, `backdrop`, and `content`.
The trigger and content are semantically linked with ARIA. Content outside is hidden from screen readers, and focus is managed automatically.
